intro: Uncinia brevicaulis, commonly known as the short-stemmed hookweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has slender, hairy stems and small, clustered leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow and bloom in late summer, producing small, wind-dispersed seeds. Uncinia brevicaulis is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as fields and along stream banks.
